summary.description: Worked in the fast pulsed systems group of the technology department on various topics related to the LHC injection kicker magnets, focused on electromagnetic interactions between the particle beam and the electromagnet. Involved in preparation of the magnets for use in high vacuum (bakeout, cleaning and high voltage conditioning) involving collaboration with engineers and technicians of varied backgrounds. Extensive simulations of the EM interactions between charged particle beams and the kicker magnet structure using both circuit representations (pSpice, Cadence) and 3D simulations (CST: Microwave Studio and HFSS), in addition to RF measurements of the EM properties of the kicker magnet using VNA.

items.description: Proposed upgrade to EM performance of magnet which was subsequently applied to all kicker magnets during 2013 maintenance shutdown.
Lead study of HV behaviour of cathode triple junction as applied to LHC kicker magnet geometry.
Physics, RF Engineering, Electromagnetics, Simulations, Computational Physics, Numerical Methods, Electrical Engineering, High Voltage, Scientific Computing

history.summary: Examining the electromagnetic interactions between charged particle beams and particle accelerator components using simulation suites and bench-top measurements techniques. Focused on normal-conducting fast pulsed electromagnets and collimators (robust beam protection equipment) necessitating dealing with competing design requirements to find optimal solutions.
highlights: Lead simulation and measurement campaign of beam coupling impedance of the LHC injection magnets
Devised an analysis technique to measure beam impedance in asymmetric structures
Systematic study of impedance reduction techniques, their advantages/disadvantages and implementation
